attributes.action: Introduce a 'political awareness test' to allow minors to qualify for the vote.
attributes.background: This idea arrived after the recent Brexit-Bremain debate when many minors felt their vote would have impacted the descision to stay or leave the European Union. The idea is also inspired by the positive impact 16 and 17 year olds had on the Scottish Refferendum. The test would allow minors to vote.
attributes.additional_details: Introduce a political awareness test which would allow citizens under the age of 18 to vote (after qualifying) in all forms of election across the UK. A test like this would eliminate the argument that minors do not know politics and therefore can't be trusted with the vote. If the minor was to pass the test, proving there awareness of politics, then they would qualify to have the ability to vote in any domestic election before age 18. The default voting age will still remain at 18.

attributes.action: Overhaul the honours system, so only selfless acts of compassion are rewarded
attributes.background: Famous people, people in power and people with money shouldn't get on the honours just because they're in those positions. It's prejudicial. They need to earn it, doing things outside their normal jobs, helping people and the community within our country. Otherwise the honours are meaningless.
attributes.additional_details: The list should be for those who help protect the country and support it outside of their paid duties. Just being rich or doing a job you're paid to do shows innate produce prejudice for the elite. We should encourage compassion and community spirit and love of our country, but the current system teaches us that if you're in the elite, or you're friends with the PM, that's all that matters. It's not supposed to be there as the PM's private thank you card.

attributes.action: Permanently seize any vehicle used by a drink/drug driver following a conviction
attributes.background: Once a person is convicted of drink/drug driving they keep the vehicle that was used during the commission of the offence. This could be following a 12 - 24 month ban passed by a court. The vehicle will usually remain outside the home address of the person convicted, until temptation to use it hits.

attributes.action: Give Au Pairs employment rights in the UK.
attributes.background: Au pairs come to the UK to learn English and experience a new culture living in with a family. In return for ones accommodation, one will help in the home and with the children for a small 'pocket money' token. In reality, this is a job and should have employment rights like all other employment.
attributes.additional_details: The laws for Au Pairs & Host Families need addressing as they are non-existent. AP's can work in excess of 60 hours per week, being paid anything from Â£35 per week, with no paid holiday or right to minimum wage. The Gov states AP's ''are unlikely to be classed as a worker or an employee.'' But why? A Nanny or cleaner are entitled to employment rights so why not AP's? It will protect both host families and AP's to have employment law to fall back on should either side need it down the line.

attributes.action: Theresa May MUST make statement to Parliament if Trump visit Petition rejected.
attributes.background: If Theresa May rejects the Petition to ban Trump on the grounds of "It would "undo everything" achieved in talks with Donald Trump" she MUST make a statement to Parliament to explain EXACTLY what she achieved on her visit to the US and why banning Trump would put that at risk.

attributes.action: To listen to the people and to trigger the article 50 so we can Brexit.
attributes.background: The people of England have spoken we need the article 50 to be triggered. We have voted for this country to be out of the EU.Therefore the government should listen to its people.
attributes.additional_details: We joined the EU for trading only NOT to be under their laws as suggested. We want democracy not to be the EU's puppets.

attributes.action: Introduce a new law to ensure all vehicles have a dash cam installed.
attributes.background:
This will serve as a very good form of evidence, in cases of poor driving on our roads, including undertaking at speed, use of cellphones whilst driving, road rage incidents, drink driving.
I have had several cases of experiencing drivers using cellphones whilst in control of their vehicles.
attributes.additional_details: I have been able to provide, evidence of anti social behaviour to the Police who have been able to take further action deemed necessary.

attributes.action: Temporarily ban breeding of domestic animals until UK pet crisis is manageable.
attributes.background: We believe preventing breeding of domestic animals for monetary gain will decrease the number of animals living in cages. Why when there are so many animals without homes are we letting people keep breeding more?. They clearly have no thought for the animals, just the money they can make.
attributes.additional_details:
It is our societies decisions that have led to the number of abandoned animals increasing year on year. Rescue centres are overwhelmed  and it is our responsibility to change this.
102,363 stray and abandoned dogs were handled by local Authorities between 2014-2015, and the RSPCA alone rescued almost 119,000 animals.

attributes.action: Make it law to wear helmets on bicycles skateboards and roller skates
attributes.background: To many fatal injuries that could be avoided if a helmet was worn
attributes.additional_details: Most children in the UK think it is a bit silly to wear helmets. In New Zealand it is the law to wear safety helmets if you are on any thing with wheels and as it is the law no child seems to mind wearing them.

attributes.action: Stop the Deportation of Sikhs and Hindus to the Islamic Republic of Afghanistan
attributes.background: While the 2004 constitution of Afghanistan allows for religions other than Islam to freely exercise their faith within the limits of the law in reality Afghan Sikhs and Hinduâs continue to face harassment and violence. on 29/12/2016 an Afghan Sikh head was shot five times, also previously targeted.
attributes.additional_details: As community size shrinks Sikhs&Hindus are finding themselves vulnerable to exploitation against which they have no defence. Dr Guiztozzi states that the reported attacks and harassment amount to a very serious threat thus 99.99% of the Minority group have opted to abandon their property and flee. Therefore, considering the small size (0.01% from 32m people) of the community prevalent & the sample episodes of abuse & harassment indicates high level of pressure on the Sikh and Hindu Community

attributes.action: Hold a general election as so we can vote on the policies of Brexit.
attributes.background: We are facing Brexit whether you voted for it or not. Now we need to vote on the terms of the Brexit. An unelected leader should not lead the Brexit negations.
attributes.additional_details:
A general election should be held to allow our parties to form their plan for Brexit allowing the electorate to have a say with the power of a vote. 

An unelected leader is not the right person for the job.

attributes.action: Repeal the European Communities Act, 1972
attributes.background: In enacting the European Communities Bill through an ordinary vote in the House of Commons, Ted Heath's Government breached the constitutional convention which requires a prior consultation of the people (either by a general election or a referendum) on any measure involving constitutional change.

attributes.action: Make grooming awareness mandatory in all schools
attributes.background: This has recently happend in my area. And I feel all children need safeguarding training in this subject.

attributes.action: Improve the quality and amount of PE in schools and spend more on school dinners
attributes.background: We are a group of Year 10 students at Greenwood Academy in Birmingham. We are campaigning to increase the amount of PE lessons in school and improve the quality of them in order to help get students healthier. We also feel school dinners lack the nutrition necessary to have healthier young people.

attributes.action: Ban or heavily tax makeup which has been tested on animals
attributes.background: I feel animals have a voice which we ignore, we should make a stand to help the animals in their innocence

attributes.action: Assure that the Banbury Horton General Hospital stays open as Oxford is too far!
attributes.background: In writing this as a ambulance practitioner I am solely concerned with patients care as for a seriously ill patient or one in cardiac arrest yo be conveyed from Banbury and surrounding area all the way to Oxford would assuredly kill them we must protect Horton Hospital as a local Banbury resource!!!
attributes.additional_details: See NHS statistics and the resuscitation councils standards for early access in cardiac arrest and cardiac event cases and or cva's/stroke victims time every single second counts

attributes.action: Increase pressure to provide vital aid and evacution to the people of Aleppo.
attributes.background: The people of East Aleppo are being slaughtered. Before our very eyes via social media, hundreds are dying from the bombardment of the city. In recent days, the situation has become even more apocalyptic - the British Government simply must do more to help these people, by providing aid and escape.

attributes.action: Have a referendum to approve a surcharge to all taxes for health & social care.
attributes.background: The main political parties are nervous of raising taxes for any purpose because of a possible election backlash. By holding a referendum, and assuming the answer is "yes", the party in government will have a mandate to raise taxation for this particular purpose.
attributes.additional_details: We are currently in a health and social care funding crisis. Local government has the responsibility but not the funds and in some case, the inclination, to support social care adequately. NHS trusts may be administratively inefficient and that has to be corrected but funding for the "sharp end" is inadequate and has to be corrected, and not by short term injections of funds.

attributes.action: Pay Special Guardianship carers the same rate as foster carers.
attributes.background: We both work full time jobs but almost 50% of my partners annual salary goes on child care cost. We should not have to be financially punished for wanting to work or cover the cost in traveling to arrange visits with the natural birth parents.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.communitycare.co.uk/2015/07/23/special-guardianship-orders-misused/

attributes.action: Freedom of movement for non-EU students during term time if no lectures missed
attributes.background: Overseas university students holding a Tiers 4 visa are technically not allowed to leave UK during term time even if they have no running modules, or they will take own risk at UK border. The university's authorised absence letter will never be approved except for emergency reason.

attributes.action: Reclassify forced entry or attempted entry into a home as an act of terrorism.
attributes.background: The distress and terror caused by someone trying to force their way into your home is a much more real and likely occurence than any threat from those acts currently classified as terrorist. These acts, however, cause real feelings of terror in the victims with a long lasting sense of insecurity.
attributes.additional_details:
From the perspective of the victim, there are far fewer resources available for the detection and apprehension of the perpetrators than there appears to be for the equivalent action against those currently considered as terrorists.
Witnessing someone attempting to force entry to your home, leave and then return with a weapon to use in the event that you confront them is a very real and terror inducing prospect for many people in this country.
It MUST be accorded the appropriate seriousness.

attributes.action: Allow 14-15 year olds to consent to sex with someone a maximum of 3 years older
attributes.background: The age of consent is currently 16, and therefore those aged below 16 are prohibited from engaging in sexual; whether protected or unprotected. My proposal is that 14 year olds should be allowed to engage in sexual activity; but only protected, and with partners who are no more than 3 years older.
attributes.additional_details: The age of consent in the UK has been 16 since 1885. Sex education has improved since 1885, and so 14 year-olds nowadays are capable of consenting to safe sex and understand the implications. Most countries in Europe have a lower age of consent than we do, which has led to calls to reduce ours. However, I believe that this is a dangerous move with paedophilia being so common today, and so I believe that my proposal is the best option. Various US states follow legislation similar to my proposal.

attributes.action: Create a report on cannabis legalisation worldwide
attributes.background:
Cannabis is being legalised and regulated worldwide, for recreational and medicinal use.

We need a full, detailed report which uses up to date science on any health benefits from cannabis and that also looks at the varying models of regulation of cannabis worldwide.

attributes.action: Over 55's to take JSA rate if they have paid full contributions for 30 yrs plus.
attributes.background: Give people the option to take early retirement on JSA rate of they have paid full contributions for 30+years. It would enable people to take early pension they have saved and get younger people in work. It could be ERP early retirement pay so they didn't need to sign on.
attributes.additional_details: I work for the local council now aged 57. I have worked all my life and saved for my pension that was suddenly moved from 60 to 66. If I and other people like me could take optional retirement at the rate that is being paid to a adult for on JSA rate, it would help the younger people get work.

attributes.action: Abolish Income Tax
attributes.background:
Income tax in the UK was introduced in 1799 as a TEMPORARY measure to fund the Napoleonic wars which ended in 1815. Income tax was abolished in 1816. 
It was later reinstalled in 1842 due to there being a growing deficit.
attributes.additional_details:
In today's society absolutely everything is taxed. For many people in minimum wage jobs this makes day to day survival a struggle. By abolishing income tax this would give them an extra Â£60-Â£80 a month which would be put towards improving their quality of life.
Many people could use this money to feed/clothe/shelter their families and as stated EVERYTHING is taxed therefore is there any need for income tax for everyone to prosper?

attributes.action: Ban vehicles greater than 7.5 tonnes from UK roads except between 8pm & 8am
attributes.background: The UK has a problem with its ageing road infrastructure that simply cannot cope with the volume of traffic that uses it on a daily basis. The volume of road traffic needs to be spread out across a 24 hour period, lorries greater than 7.5 tonnes should only be permitted to travel between 8pm and 8am
attributes.additional_details: The average daily commute has just increased to 2 hours and the general public is being forced to spend wholly unacceptable amounts of time in cars for what are often small journeys. Forcing drivers off the road through increased taxes or toll roads is not the answer. The answer is obvious but the government won't take the action required to tackle the problem. Road traffic needs to be spread out over the 24 hour period and allow vehicles greater than 7.5 tonnes to only travel between 8pm - 8am

attributes.action: Put FEMINISM WEEK on the National Curriculum: female role models in all subjects
attributes.background: As a fully qualified teacher I know first hand that some schools rarely teach about feminism at all. For just one week of the academic year, if we could teach not just the history of feminism, but celebrate the achievements of females today in every subject, we could inspire true equality in the U.K
attributes.additional_details:
Feminism is already on the rise: our education system should be at the forefront of the movement. Not just #heforshe and #equalpay trending on Twitter; but opening the minds of all students male, female and LGTBQ to believe in total equality for their generation, both at home and in the work place - so no matter what gender you are born, you can dream just as big, and command the same respect.

I am aware that teachers have to cover what is on the exams but one week will not interfere too much.

attributes.action: Don't take prosecution powers away from RSPCA, give them more powers.
attributes.background: The Environment, Food and Rural Affairs Committee wants the Government to take away private prosecution rights for the RSPCA. Instead of taking away powers, we should be delivering the RSPCA more rights to be able to seize without Police needing to be present.
attributes.additional_details:
The RSPCA has a 92% conviction rate for cases that they take to the courts, this is more than the CPS.

The Environment Food and Rural Affairs Committee want prosecutions given to the CPS instead.

The RSPCA should have more rights to take animals rather than having to wait 24 hours, or calling the Police as animals could be going through torment whilst waiting for the RSPCA to return.

For emergencies that the Police call them too, they should be given some form of emergency lighting as it can take them hours to arrive.

attributes.action: Investigate the link between 3G Football pitches and cancer.
attributes.background: 3G Football pitches are made from crumb rubber, pellets of which are often made from used car tyres, which contain toxic chemicals. It has been suggested that if these chemicals enter the body through, for example, cuts or scratches then they can contribute to Cancer.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35585392
http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11095/10154596/report-claims-link-between-3g-pitches-and-cancer

attributes.action: Protect the NE-Derbyshire parliamentry constituency from boundary changes.
attributes.background: There has been proposed boundary changes around the UK, one including my local constituency 'North East Derbyshire', it's been proposed that the constituency be scrapped but replaced with two new ones, which obviously doesn't make sense and is completely unnecessary.
attributes.additional_details:
The proposed boundary changes are in a sense 'undemocratic', local residents vote for a candidate to represent their constituency as their local MP, but changes are confusing local residents and angering some.

My source for this information is local media and other sources, I recommend googling about it, to find more information to prove this.

attributes.action: Stop parking charges at hospitals for visitors & staff, charges for TV & phone
attributes.background: I have been in hospital several times, cost Â£1.60 per hr, Â£7.50 per day for TV, 3 minute phone call cost Â£2.00. I am an OAP and cannot afford these prices.
attributes.additional_details: Being old I am in and out of hospital

attributes.action: The awareness of FGM (female genital mutilation) to increase in schools.
attributes.background: FGM is the practice of partially or totally removing the external genitalia. Until recently I had no idea what FGM was. i had no idea that girls all around the world could be suffering from FGM. When people explained it to me I was horrified.
attributes.additional_details: Due to this more awareness should be given to students. This could help stop the practice of FGM in this country completely. FGM is still a big problem here even though it is illegal.

attributes.action: Create specialist knife crime units within the police.
attributes.background: In areas that have high levels of knife crime. Specialist knife crime units need to be created within the police, to tackle this ongoing issue.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.birminghammail.co.uk/news/midlands-news/black-october-knife-crime-after-12086384.amp

attributes.action: Special funding to Councils for social housing for adults with disabilities
attributes.background: Many local authorities have social housing problems... but more so for adults with physical disabilities and/or learning disabilities (who may require shared living). Where housing associations have stepped in to provide properties they charge rents far beyond what is affordable on housing benefit.
attributes.additional_details: Many social housing properties are in disadvantaged areas with high crime, making them unsafe for many adults with learning disabilities, or properties are ill suited for the person's physical disabilities... this results in many people having to continue living wth parents long into adulthood... with complex care needs that place unsustainable pressure on the family relationship increasing the risk of crisis or carer breakdown.

attributes.action: Make Armistice Day 2018 a national holiday
attributes.background: As the 11th of November 2018 will be the centenary of the end of the Great War (WW1) I believe as a make of respect the whole of the UK should have a national holiday to remember the fallen.

attributes.action: Make Wildlife/ natural history a compulsory part of the national curriculum
attributes.background: Wildlife around the globe is decreasing at a ferocious rate, not just oversea but on our very own soil. By educating generations about the value of wildlife, the ecosystem and what animals do for us, only then will the world halt the decline in our amazing Wildlife.
attributes.additional_details:
An audit of more than 200 native species - including birds, bats, moths, butterflies, hares and dormice - shows that priority species have declined on average by 58% since 1970 - The guardian

 âThe natural world is in serious trouble and it needs our help as never before.â  Sir David Attenborough

attributes.action: Publish all registered sex offenders names, addresses and nature of crime.
attributes.background: America allows all law enforcement to publish to the public the names, addresses and crimes committed by all sex offenders.  we as the UK public should be able to have this information to keep our kids safe.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Megan%27s_Law Link to background info on Megan's law this has been running successfully for many years and is proof that it works! The united kingdom public should be informed in order to protect our children if we don't know where they are how can we protect our vulnerable members of society.

attributes.action: Do not impose the Bedroom Tax on Pensioners
attributes.background: Pensioners have paid Taxes all their working lives now in their latter years with low state Pensions cannot afford to pay an unfair cut in Housing Benefit which is another form of Poll Tax.
attributes.additional_details: The Tory Government is soon to impose the Bedroom Tax on Pensioners by cutting Housing Benefit to OAPS that have extra bedrooms they say people don't use. Some couples need to sleep alone because of different ailments they have so need the extra bedroom, there is not enough Social Housing to rehouse everybody its Social Blackmail which is not Fair on people who have paid Taxes all their working lives and are about to be hit with an unfair Tax in their Twilight Years when they don't need the worry of it all

attributes.action: Stop development of new fossil fuel reserves to comply with the Paris agreement.
attributes.background: See for example : https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/sep/27/fracking-digging-drilling-paris-agreement-fossil-fuels

attributes.action: Government should put a stop to paying of TV licence in the UK!!
attributes.background:
Government should put a stop to paying of tv licence because is not acceptable!
I have lived in spain and other parts of eu country and they don't ask their citizens to pay for TV licence. 
You can make research for yourself.
attributes.additional_details: Most eu countries don't ask for TV licence.

attributes.action: Keep present allowances for disabled and assisted accomodation tenants.
attributes.background: The present efforts by the government to attack the poorest and most vulnerable in our society must stop.I work with both the disabled and the homeless who do not have a voice. Help me and sign this petition to be their voice.
attributes.additional_details: Rental allowances from benefit are capped and often fall short of the required amount- which then has to be topped up from benefits- often leaving individuals with less than Â£60 a week for all their needs (food, toiletries, transport, household goods etc) This is inhuman treatment of the most vulnerable in our society who need our help and support.The allowances should be kept and increased yearly in line with the cost of living index.

attributes.action: Permanently move Parliament to a more UK population central location.
attributes.background: The seat of power in the UK has for too long resided in a place inaccessible to most of the country. This has resulted in generations of regional underinvestment and the revenue creation capacity of our country massively skewed to financial services in the City, Greater London and the South East
attributes.additional_details: With a new parliament location a more commutable distance, we can also do away with the cost of many second homes for MPs. The Â£40+Billion cost of HS2 can be reallocated to pay for a new Parliament building (The final cost of Holyrood was put at Â£414M) and the renewal of the rail infrastructure to support it. After hundreds of years of revenue flowing from the rest of the UK to the South East, itâs about time it started seeding sustainable growth elsewhere.

attributes.action: Bring in a law to stop any more buildings over 30 floors being built in London.
attributes.background: London isn't Manhattan. Our original environment is dwarfed by mega-towers that no-one lives in. Let's ask the Government to bring in planning law to prevent any more towers over 30 floors being built in Central London. Those extra floors aren't solving any housing crisis - just overseas investors
attributes.additional_details:
Guardian article on 50 story St George's Wharf tower - the blight of Vauxhall riverside: 
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/may/24/revealed-foreign-buyers-own-two-thirds-of-tower-st-george-wharf-london
This Ipsos mori survey for Skyline Campaign suggests that lots of people agree with me: 
http://workplaceinsight.net/majority-of-londoners-support-greater-restrictions-on-new-tall-buildings/

attributes.action: Abolish the wasteful Brexit (Exiting the EU) and International Trade Departments
attributes.background: These departments replicate functions of the existing Foreign and Cabinet Offices and Business Department. They're wasteful and disruptive, serving no useful function. Britain's governing party and its squabbling ministers should settle their differences over Europe internally not at public expense.
attributes.additional_details:
https://twitter.com/lewiscoughlan/status/764377677038030848

http://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/hiring-brexit-experts-will-cost-billions-khn6mw3j2

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/08/13/liam-fox-and-boris-johnson-locked-in-feud-over-who-controls-brit/

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3749965/ANDREW-PIERCE-longer-Theresa-tolerate-three-backstabbing-Brexiteers.html

attributes.action: Legal limit for clearance of the accidents and road re opening under 2 hours.
attributes.background:
23/08/2016 M27 closed FOR 6 HOURS! at Junction Two for Salisbury after caravan overturns on A31 near Cadnam. 
Excessive amount of work, Excessive shut down, Dangerous situation for public and the Nature on Diverted routs.
attributes.additional_details:
Road maintenance looks increasingly like a gravy train! Inefficiency is really spectacular ! They obviously sacrificed efficiency to illusion of safety. The question, how many accidents has happened on diverted routs? How many social and economic consequences from that careless inaction? How bad an congestion impact on nature? 
And it is everywhere, not only accidents. Why to limit 20 Ml of M3 from Heathrow to Fleet? We hear lots of words about infrastructure so far, but no action!

attributes.action: Increase tax allowance to Â£14,976 per year so minimum wage pay no tax on income
attributes.background: We believe this would encourage people back into full time employment whilst reducing benefits claims to a degree. This action may influence our economy as there would be potential for more disposable income.

attributes.action: Change E.S.A back to Incapacity benefit
attributes.background: I believe the current policies regarding ESA are wrong and unreasonable to the extent that the long term sick, are sick and not able to work, the decision to put the sick into work makes no sense as the illnesses are still there and there is no work for long term sufferers.

attributes.action: Create fair & honest revenue stream for NHS & social care with hypothecated tax
attributes.background: It's time UK govt & people had a grown-up relationship with NHS and social care funding. Replace NI contributions with a stand alone tax to fund NHS & social care. The people would then see the true costs and politicians could say how much or how little they were willing to raise in their manifesto
attributes.additional_details: Obviously not all tax revenue comes from people's income. There would still be a proportion coming from Corporation, Value Added and other tax raising streams. However these proportions could be protected so the percentage of burden on the population's income always remains the same.

attributes.action: Abolish Stamp Duty on Main Home
attributes.background: People need to move house for many reasons, job, health, family, personal circumstances change etc. they should be able to move easily, without a financial penalty being paid to the government. But they can't because of stamp duty. It locks people in unsuitable homes and restricts movement.
attributes.additional_details: Most have to add the stamp duty tax to their mortgage. How can taking out a loan for 25-30 years to pay the government for the privilege of moving home be right. Stamp duty tax is damaging the property market, peoples lives & the economy. Many people that want to, or need to move cannot, simply because of the enormous cost of stamp duty. Stamp Duty tax needs to be abolished.

attributes.action: Review the PIPs scoring system as being Dickensian & unfair in the 21st century.
attributes.background: The current review system is bias & unfair against disabled people who rely highly on access to places that abled people enjoy on a daily basis.
attributes.additional_details: Disabled people are made to feel like criminals during & following the reviews. They're made to apply for this benefit in a totally bias and unfair way on a claim form which asks 10 questions towards daily living but only 2 on mobility, which is the main purpose for disabled people applying for this benefit, in the first place. Maybe, if there must be 12 questions, a balance of 6 for daily living & 6 for mobility would be fairer & maybe provide a better view of a individuals needs?
